org.dmd.dmp.server.servlet.extended
Class SessionRI

java.lang.Object
  org.dmd.dmc.DmcContainer

                  org.dmd.dmp.server.servlet.generated.dmw.SessionRIDMW
                      org.dmd.dmp.server.servlet.extended.SessionRI
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.dmd.dmc.DmcContainerIF, org.dmd.dmc.DmcHierarchicNamedObjectIF, org.dmd.dmc.DmcNamedObjectIF, org.dmd.dmp.server.DmpPipeIF, DmpEventHandlerIF, DmpResponseHandlerIF
public class SessionRI
extends SessionRIDMW
implements DmpResponseHandlerIF, org.dmd.dmp.server.DmpPipeIF, DmpEventHandlerIF

The SessionRI class represents an authenticated user session. All requests are verified by the security manager to ensure that they have a valid session. Sessions also create the named event channel for the GWT Event Service through which we send DMPEvents and asynchronous responses.

The SessionRI is at the heart of all interactions between the client and the server. Each session has a unique registration with the cache so that all operations performed against the data can be uniquely identified as coming from a particular cache registrant. This allows us to distinguish who did what to the data. On the client, this mechanism can be used to determine whether events coming from the server were caused by you or by some other client.

Constructor Detail

SessionRI

public SessionRI()
The empty constructor required for compatibility with the modification recorder mechanisms. This is never used to create an actual session for use within the DMP reference implementation.

handleResponse

public void handleResponse(org.dmd.dmp.server.extended.Request request,
                           org.dmd.dmp.server.extended.Response response)
If there have been any operations that have multiple responses e.g. GetRequests with a blocking factor or ActionRequests etc., the first response goes back via the usual mechanisms. Subsequent responses are sent back asynchronously as events. The org.dmd.mvw.client.mvwcomms.extended.CommsController knows how to route these asynchronous responses back to the appropriate component.

Specified by:
handleResponse in interface DmpResponseHandlerIF
Parameters:
request - The original request, which in this case isn't used.
response - The asynchronous response.
